Text: It's coming, hurry!
Activating Anemone!
Bit: \n This is the Brink - a dimension between dimensions.
Bit: \n Everything you have lost is here.
Everything I've lost?
What \n happened!?
Long time no see, \n Raven.
You...?

You and the other 
 are one being, 
 split by fate, 
 forced to be two.
While this unnatural state \n has caused many \n unforeseen difficulties...
At the moment, \n it could be an \n unforeseen blessing.
Who are you?
You know me.
Sachya, \n remember.
The fire of the gods! \n It's real...
It's you!
Everything has led to this \n moment. The king has unleashed \n Elektricitie upon Hekseville.

If something is in the 
 king's way, Elektricitie 
 has more than enough 
 power to remove it.
You're one of \n them. Like Gade \n and Cyanea.

Think of me as a servant, 
 fulfilling my duty by helping 
 correct the issues that 
 occur in this world.
Where's Kat?
She has to deal with \n consequences set in \n motion a century ago.
Then it's up to \n me to buy her \n time.

Until Alua... Kat remembers 
 who she truly is, you'll be 
 all that stands between the 
 world and Elektricitie.
Long time no see, Kat.
Syd? Is that really you? \n Where have you-
Never mind.
It's not important, if \n you're safe, that's all \n that matters.
Well, I'm here, but I'm \n not here at the same \n time...
What do you mean? Where \n are you? Are you going \n somewhere?

You heard the Creator. 
 This is The Brink - a 
 dimension between 
 dimensions.
Creator? You mean that \n little boy I just met?
He's the same boy that \n saved me back in \n Hekseville...
He's the one that \n created this place.
All the things yet to be \n born, all the things \n lost...

All of them exist here, 
 yet don't exist too. 
 That's why this is the 
 Brink.
It's not like you to \n make things so \n complicated...

I know, but it's 
 important for you to 
 understand, to remember 
 when you were Alua.
Alua? What would I need \n with that Queen's boring \n memories?

Face the past, accept 
 it. You must if you want 
 to become your true 
 self.

Use your power to forge 
 a path and step forward. 
 The doors to your 
 memories will open.

I'll be waiting 100 
 years ago at the 
 place where 
 everything began...
Wait! Don't leave me \n alone!
That's just like Syd to \n run off without \n explaining things.
You've finally made it, \n Gravity Queen.
It took some work \n getting you here.
Is there a reason \n you brought me here?

Yes, but it was 
 important you reach 
 here by your own 
 free will.

From the rift planes, 
 you've gained the 
 power to change, 
 to open new paths.
Now you must walk \n those paths.

And discover the 
 truth behind what 
 happened to you a 
 hundred years ago.
Queen Alua!
Stop!
Alua...?
For the first time, I felt frustration at how powerless I was...
This is the truth of what took place a hundred years ago...
A memory of me, before I was Kat of Hekseville, \n back when I was Queen Alua.
Xicero, please! Give me \n your hand.
Queen Alua, you don't \n belong here.
If it weren't for you, \n everything would be so \n much smoother.
What are you talking \n about!? I'm your queen.
If you want to live, \n give me the crystal!
The one with that silly \n message you recorded.
I don't have it!
Please, I'm slipping!
Then it would seem I no \n longer need you.
A true queen would have \n her guardian to save \n her.
But you're nothing but a \n powerless fool.
Please... Someone \n help... Syd...

I was sent to 
 observe this world 
 until the day it 
 returned to nothing.
But I can't stand by \n and do nothing while \n you and he struggle.
Your strength has woken \n in me a need to prevent \n the un-preventable.

When Syd came to Hekseville, 
 I gave form to his desire to 
 be strong. His desire to 
 protect.
Even gods can \n be moved.
This world isn't created by the \n dreams of gods, but by the \n dreams of humankind.
And the gods themselves \n can't escape the laws \n of this world forever.
This is the last time \n I can guide you.
Raven and the people \n of Hekseville need \n your help.
Syd! Don't leave me again...
Attendant: \n Queen Alua doesn't even have a guardian.
Attendant: \n Everyone knows bringing her to the castle was a mistake.
Alua: \n Why don't I have a guardian?
Syd... I will find you again.
Is that the place where everything began Syd was talking about?
Attendant: \n I've heard her being called the fallen queen.
Was that me a hundred years ago?
Senator: \n We still have a millennia before the dark sea reaches Eto.
Senator: \n I'm sure future generations will figure out how to stop it.
Alua: \n But what about the people down below? We can't cast them away!
Senator: \n Their fate is sealed, we can't help them.
Alua: \n Please, you have to listen to me!
Senator: \n My Queen, I'm afraid the Senate has made its decision.
Nobody would listen to me a hundred years ago.
Alua: \n The stories of people living down below are true...
Alua: \n I just want to save them, is that so wrong?
I remember now. I was so hurt and frustrated...
Alua: \n I can't let this happen!
Alua: \n Those are people down there! We can't let this happen.
Alua: \n We can evacuate them up here, to Eto!
Alua: \n Syd, tell me you're with me on this!
Syd: \n Queen Alua, I understand how you feel...
Syd: \n But you're the queen, your responsibility is to Eto.
Alua: \n Syd... I thought you of all people would understand.
I remember... Syd was there a hundred years ago.
Xicero: \n The queen is dangerous. I'm proposing we have her deposed.
Syd: \n But she has it in her to be a great queen.
Syd: \n She's just a little young and inexperienced.
Xicero: \n I'm disappointed in you.
Why were they arguing? I'm not sure I want to remember.
Alua: \n I am the queen of Eto.
Alua: \n People of below, you must evacuate to Eto.
Alua: \n We will take you in.
Alua: \n I won't give up, I can't let this happen...
That's right... And now I remember what happened next.
Syd: \n This is our last memory together. Farewell, Kat.
Syd, please! Don't go!
I just have to connect up the paths.
The power to change...
I just have to connect everything up...
If I fall, the platforms seem to reset...
